alert.note: Alert for Far Northwest Highlands; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 21 at 3:40AM MST until February 23 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches below 7,500 feet and 4 to 8 inches above 7,500 feet. Winds gusting to between 45 and 65 mph. * WHERE...Far Northwest Highlands and West Central Mountains. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-40. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Far Northwest Highlands; West Central Mountains
